intro: Epidendrum denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), with a distinctive toothed margin that gives it its common name. Epidendrum denticulatum is relatively easy to care for, making it a popular choice for both novice and experienced orchid growers.
